Pacman.Model
Class Game

java.lang.Object
  Pacman.Model.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public final class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

The model. The game class holds the map, player and ghosts.

See Also:

Constant Field Values

score

How many points the player has scored so far.

map

private Map map
The map, containing all the MapBlocks.

originalMap

private Map originalMap
Once the player eats dots, the map is altered. After the game is finished, the originalMap needs to be restored.

private Player player
The player object.

Constructor Detail

Game

public Game()
default constructor. creates a new game with default values. saved games can be restored using the other constructor.

Method Detail

init

public void init()
(Re)initializes the parts of the game that may have changed during previous games, therefore this does not happen in the constructor.

start

public void start()
Start the game. This also starts the game characters.

stop

public void stop()
Stops/Pauses the game, so it can be resumed later

To load new levels.

getSpecialItemMode

public boolean getSpecialItemMode()
Checks whether specialItemMode is active. If the time limit has been reached, special item mode is deactivated.

getScore

public int getScore()
Gets score.

addScore

void addScore(int n)
Adds a provided amount of points to score.

Parameters:
n - Number of points to add.

enableSpecialItem

void enableSpecialItem()
Enables special item mode. This also sets the time limit.

gameOver

void gameOver()
Ends the game by stopping all the game characters and changing the game state.

Sets score to 0.

restoreOriginalMap

private void restoreOriginalMap()
Restore map to originalMap, so the eaten dots aren't gone for the next game.

Stores the value of map into originalMap, so it can be retrieved later.
